content:
• Friday, September 30, 2011
  • AABA

    "We are very interested" in pursuing Yahoo (YHOO) - the "whole" company, says Alibaba...

    "We are very interested" in pursuing Yahoo (YHOO) - the "whole" company, says Alibaba (OTC:ALBCF) CEO Jack Ma after a direct question at a Stanford forum. The answer suggests the key Yahoo partner wants to be the leader in a deal rather than a cog in a group. YHOO up 3% AH. (earlier)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:14 PM | 2 Comments
  • ARCH

    Arch Coal (NYSE:ACI) cuts FY11 EPS guidance to $1.00-1.40 from $1.75-$2.15, with EBITDA at...

    Arch Coal (NYSE:ACI) cuts FY11 EPS guidance to $1.00-1.40 from $1.75-$2.15, with EBITDA at $900M-$1B representing the highest level in company history but below previous guidance. The company blames the downward revisions on lost metallurgical coal production at its Mountain Laurel complex. ACI -10% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM | 2 Comments
  • PBR

    Crude oil storage is reported burning at Petrobras' (PBR -3.5%) 100K-barrel-per-day refinery in...

    Crude oil storage is reported burning at Petrobras' (PBR -3.5%) 100K-barrel-per-day refinery in Pasadena, Texas. The company plans to pour investment into refining over the next few years.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • SPRD

    Spreadtrum (SPRD +6.6%) shoots higher after the wireless chipmaker announces it's reached the...

    Spreadtrum (SPRD +6.6%) shoots higher after the wireless chipmaker announces it's reached the last milestone needed to recognize an $8M R&D grant from CHL. Spreadtrum's CEO uses the announcement to note his company's corporate structure is different from the one sparking regulatory fears for other Chinese ADRs. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM
  • NOK

    A number of Euro tech names are underperforming, as the EU's inflation report once more bring...

    A number of Euro tech names are underperforming, as the EU's inflation report once more bring the continent's economic woes into the spotlight. ALU -7.3%. ERIC -3.1%. NXPI -5.1%. VELT -5.7%. AIXG -8.2%. ASML -3.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM
  • ACUR

    Shares of Acura Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ACUR) move 16.6% higher after announcing on Tuesday it won...

    Shares of Acura Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ACUR) move 16.6% higher after announcing on Tuesday it won a key patent for its drug abuse deterrent formulation.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM
  • DMAN

    DemandTec (NASDAQ:DMAN), a provider of cloud software for retailers and consumer goods...

    DemandTec (NASDAQ:DMAN), a provider of cloud software for retailers and consumer goods companies, gains 8.6% after reporting FQ2 revenue of $22M (+8% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.02, in-line with consensus. With shares near their 52-week low before today's move, investors seem willing to overlook a 9% Q/Q decline in DemandTec's deferred revenue balance.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM
  • BRCD

    Brocade (NASDAQ:BRCD) is up 3.4% on above-average volume, on a day when nearly all other major...

    Brocade (NASDAQ:BRCD) is up 3.4% on above-average volume, on a day when nearly all other major networking and storage names are trading lower. The switch vendor has frequently been the subject of takeover chatter.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM
  • KODK

    Eastman Kodak (EK -49.1%) nosedives on a report the company is hiring restructuring lawyers. Two...

    Eastman Kodak (EK -49.1%) nosedives on a report the company is hiring restructuring lawyers. Two days ago, Fitch cut its rating on Kodak's debt to a level suggesting a default is probable.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM | 5 Comments
  • BKS

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (NYSE:BKS) dip even lower, losing 4%, in a memorable week that saw...

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (NYSE:BKS) dip even lower, losing 4%, in a memorable week that saw Kindle-news take a hatchet to BKS' pricing and margins on its Nook e-readers. The latest word: 8GB Nook Colors selling for $149.99 on a daily deals site.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • XRTX

    Though Xyratex (XRTX +3.1%) initially fell after reporting FQ3 results featuring weak guidance,...

    Though Xyratex (XRTX +3.1%) initially fell after reporting FQ3 results featuring weak guidance, shares have reversed course as multiple analysts come to the storage vendor's defense. Brean Murray (Buy) believes Xyratex's fundamentals are bottoming, and Needham (Buy) is lifting its FY12 EPS forecast on an improved gross margin outlook.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM
  • SHW

    KeyBanc Capital initiates shares of Sherwin-Williams (SHW -1.5%) with a Hold rating, saying a...

    KeyBanc Capital initiates shares of Sherwin-Williams (SHW -1.5%) with a Hold rating, saying a depressed North American housing and construction market will keep demand for its products lukewarm. It's still a good week for the paint products company, up 5.3% and outperforming rivals.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM
  • AEGN

    Insituform Technologies (INSU -13.9%) has had an interesting ride over the last 2 days. After...

    Insituform Technologies (INSU -13.9%) has had an interesting ride over the last 2 days. After getting clobbered yesterday on an earnings warning, shares rallied in late-day trading to close up 1%. But they're crashing again today after Wedbush downgrades them to Neutral, citing "persistent challenges" and "poor earnings visibility."
     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM
  • AJRD

    GenCorp (GY +10%) pops after missing Q3 EPS estimates by $0.04 on revenue of $226M (+7.4% Y/Y)....

    GenCorp (GY +10%) pops after missing Q3 EPS estimates by $0.04 on revenue of $226M (+7.4% Y/Y). Investors seem to be honing in on the healthy backlog of orders the defense contractor reports.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM
  • GHDX

    Genomic Health (GHDX +5.9%) spikes higher after announcing the national contractor for its...

    Genomic Health (GHDX +5.9%) spikes higher after announcing the national contractor for its Oncotype DX colon cancer testing product has established Medicare coverage for it.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM
  • SPPI

    Shares of Spectrum Pharmaceutical (SPPI +3.6%) get a lift when analysts at Auriga initiate...

    Shares of Spectrum Pharmaceutical (SPPI +3.6%) get a lift when analysts at Auriga initiate coverage with a Buy rating and $11.50 price target - repping 47% upside potential. The drugmaker sells Zevalin and Fusilev in the U.S., and its pipeline includes various hematology-oncology and urology treatments in advance trials.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM
  • MS

    In a sharp reversal from yesterday's performance, many U.S. bank stocks are down hard, as bad EU...

    In a sharp reversal from yesterday's performance, many U.S. bank stocks are down hard, as bad EU inflation data heightens concerns about eurozone exposure fallout. MS -6.9%. GS -3.8%. BK -3.1%. BAC -2.4%. Insurers aren't faring much better. AIG -3.8%. HIG -3.3%. MET -2.9%. AFL -2.3%. (Euro banks)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • MU

    Though Micron (MU -11.9%) is crashing due to its FQ4 report, NAND supplier Sandisk (SNDK +2.2%)...

    Though Micron (MU -11.9%) is crashing due to its FQ4 report, NAND supplier Sandisk (SNDK +2.2%) seems to be catching a bid from it. The reason? While Micron's DRAM sales fell, its NAND sales rose 11% Q/Q. And during its CC, Micron expressed optimism about NAND demand, while claiming its NAND margins have been relatively stable.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • GSK

    Shares of Human Genome Sciences (HGSI -5.4%) take a hit after reports say U.K. regulators are...

    Shares of Human Genome Sciences (HGSI -5.4%) take a hit after reports say U.K. regulators are considering not providing coverage for its lupus drug Benlysta. The decision looks controversial after the drug already won U.S. and European approval, with a Merchant Securities analyst going so far as to say it seems "incredulous."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • OLED

    Universal Display (NASDAQ:PANL) gains 3.6% after announcing a licensing deal with Pioneer for...

    Universal Display (NASDAQ:PANL) gains 3.6% after announcing a licensing deal with Pioneer for the use of its OLED technology in lighting products. Like a similar deal announced with Panasonic, the agreement calls for royalties on product sales. Universal Display's shares surged last month on a licensing deal with Samsung for OLED display products.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM

  • Portage Resources (POTG) soars 34% after a subsidiary acquires a 55% stake in a Peruvian mining...

    Portage Resources (POTG) soars 34% after a subsidiary acquires a 55% stake in a Peruvian mining operation. The company's CEO says, "preliminary Independent lab results indicated lower grades of gold and silver but massive volume results."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM
  • MOS

    Fertilizer stocks are hit after the USDA reports corn stockpiles are 150M bushels larger than...

    Fertilizer stocks are hit after the USDA reports corn stockpiles are 150M bushels larger than expected. Mosaic (MOS -6.9%) shares hit a 52-week low; CF Industries (CF -7.3%) also slides. But chicken producers Sanderson Farms (SAFM +4.3%) and Tyson Foods (TSN +4.3%) gain, along with pork processor Smithfield (SFD +4%), benefiting from lower animal feed prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM | 7 Comments
  • SVN

    It's not just Internet names that are selling off on accounting fears for U.S.-listed Chinese...

    It's not just Internet names that are selling off on accounting fears for U.S.-listed Chinese companies. Hotel owners 7 Days (SVN -8.7%) and Home Inns & Motels (HMIN -14.7%) are also off sharply, and so is ad network owner Focus Media (FMCN -7.8%).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • IR

    Ingersoll-Rand (IR -16.8%) declines sharply thanks to its Q3 warning. Wedbush is reiterating a...

    Ingersoll-Rand (IR -16.8%) declines sharply thanks to its Q3 warning. Wedbush is reiterating a Market Perform, believing currency effects will add to existing headwinds in hurting Q4 results. It also thinks the "continued underperformance" of Ingersoll's Residential Solutions business brings its 2013 EPS target into question. Rival LII is down 7.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • MRK

    Merck (NYSE:MRK) stands as the biggest gainer in the Dow, up 1.2%, after strategically freeing...

    Merck (NYSE:MRK) stands as the biggest gainer in the Dow, up 1.2%, after strategically freeing itself up to offer more over-the-counter drugs by selling its interest in a joint venture with Johnson & Johnson (JNJ +0.2%).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • MU

    Micron (MU -10.6%) tumbles thanks to a weak FQ4 report highlighted by a major EPS miss,...

    Micron (MU -10.6%) tumbles thanks to a weak FQ4 report highlighted by a major EPS miss, plummeting margins, and significant cash burn. Wedbush's Betsy Van Hees is cutting shares to Neutral, expecting Micron to continue posting losses until 2H '12, due to soft DRAM demand in the consumer PC space. (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM
  • H

    Hotel stocks continue a skittish trend, led by a 4% decline in shares of Hyatt Hotels (NYSE:H)....

    Hotel stocks continue a skittish trend, led by a 4% decline in shares of Hyatt Hotels (NYSE:H). The sensitivity of hotel stocks to every piece of economic news is one reason the WSJ's Jack Hough says REITS with well-managed portfolios look like a good alternative play. Hotel decliners: MAR -3.4%, HOT -3.4%, IHG -3.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM
  • BID

    Shares of Sotheby's (NYSE:BID) fall 6.3% at market open, getting no help from Zacks upgrading...

    Shares of Sotheby's (NYSE:BID) fall 6.3% at market open, getting no help from Zacks upgrading the company to Outperform. Instead, ruling the day is sentiment that luxury retailers are in line for falling sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM | 2 Comments
  • BIDU

    Chinese Internet stocks continue to plummet  following yesterday's reports of DOJ, SEC, and...

    Chinese Internet stocks continue to plummet  following yesterday's reports of DOJ, SEC, and FBI investigations into alleged accounting fraud. BIDU -6.2%. SINA -5.1%. SOHU -6.3%. SNDA -3.7%. YOKU -4.4%. TUDO -8%. RENN -7.5%. MOBI -5.3%. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • LVS

    The prospect for slower growth in China (I, II) casts another dark cloud on casino companies...

    The prospect for slower growth in China (I, II) casts another dark cloud on casino companies with revenue tied to Macau. In short: "China's economy may be slowing down," notes an analyst with CIMB Securities. Decliners: LVS -8.1%, MPEL -6.2%, WYNN -9.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM
  • SUNH

    Sun Healthcare (NASDAQ:SUNH) falls 6.8% after updating investors with lower guidance for FY11...

    Sun Healthcare (NASDAQ:SUNH) falls 6.8% after updating investors with lower guidance for FY11 after reviewing the impact of new rules for skilled nursing facilities. The company now sees revenue between $1.925B-$1.945B - down from previous guidance of $1.95B-$1.995B - and EPS falling in a range of $0.83-$0.94.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM
  • IOC

    InterOil (NYSE:IOC), whose shares were crushed this week (I, II) due to fears of a natural gas...

    InterOil (NYSE:IOC), whose shares were crushed this week (I, II) due to fears of a natural gas project in Papua New Guinea being cancelled, gains 1.1% premarket after announcing it's hired i-banks to help evaluate proposals for obtaining a partner for the project. InterOil says the move comes after "consultation" with Papua New Guinea's government.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM
  • TPR

    Shares of Coach (COH) and Tiffany (NYSE:TIF) - beat up badly yesterday on concerns over growth...

    Shares of Coach (COH) and Tiffany (NYSE:TIF) - beat up badly yesterday on concerns over growth in China - extend downward again after China's central bank says fighting inflation is job #1. Premarket: COH -1.9%, TIF -1.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:35 AM
  • EQNR

    Shares of Statoil (STO) post a steady 2% gain premarket after the oil concern says it see...

    Shares of Statoil (STO) post a steady 2% gain premarket after the oil concern says it see significant upside potential from the massive Avaldsnes oil find in the Norwegian North Sea, backing up estimates made by Lundin earlier today.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:14 AM
  • HRBN

    Beleaguered Harbin Electric (NASDAQ:HRBN) shoots up 9% premarket after moving a step beyond...

    Beleaguered Harbin Electric (NASDAQ:HRBN) shoots up 9% premarket after moving a step beyond mailing proxy materials - scheduling a special meeting Oct. 29 to vote on a $24 offer to take the company private.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:44 AM | 1 Comment
  • YGE

    Yingli Green Energy (NYSE:YGE) announces a $100M share repurchasement program to buy back shares...

    Yingli Green Energy (NYSE:YGE) announces a $100M share repurchasement program to buy back shares in the open market over the next 12 months. Shares are  up 4.4% premarket after falling off 48% over the last month.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:30 AM
  • IR

    Ingersoll-Rand (NYSE:IR) revises its estimate for Q3 APS downward to $0.77-$0.80, from previous...

    Ingersoll-Rand (NYSE:IR) revises its estimate for Q3 APS downward to $0.77-$0.80, from previous guidance of $0.85-$0.95, including a $0.04 impact from Hussman operations. The company now sees Q3 revenue in a range of $3.9B-$3.95B, from prior guidance of $4.05B-$4.15B. Shares -5.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:20 AM
  • DB

    Losses for banks in Europe widened after the unexpected rise in CPI in Europe, Deutsche...

    Losses for banks in Europe widened after the unexpected rise in CPI in Europe, Deutsche (NYSE:DB) fell 6% in Frankfurt and Societe Generale (SCGGLY.PK) dropped 7% in Paris. Shares of SocGen took an extra punch to the gut after UBS downgraded the French bank to Neutral from Buy on a "stressed" valuation.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:44 AM | 1 Comment
